infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel

Class KernelEstimatorMultiVariate

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel.KernelEstimatorMultiVariate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KernelEstimatorTransferEntropy, KernelEstimatorTransferEntropyMultiVariate

    public class KernelEstimatorMultiVariate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

    Class to maintain probability distribution function for a multivariate set, using kernel estimates.

    For more details on kernel estimation for computing probability distribution functions, see Kantz and Schreiber (below).

    TODO More thoroughly check the Javadocs here

    References:

    • H. Kantz and T. Schreiber, "Nonlinear Time Series Analysis" (Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, MA, 1997).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    KernelEstimatorUniVariate

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(double[][] data1,
                   double[][] data2)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Each row of the data is an observation; each column of the row is a new variable in the multivariate observation. This method signature allows the user to call setObservations for joint time series without combining them into a single joint time series (we do the combining for them).
        Parameters:
        data1 -
        data2 -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - When the length of the two arrays of observations do not match.

      • getCount

        public int getCount(double[] observation,
           int timeStep)

        Return the kernel count for the probability with dynamic correlation exlcusion if it has been switched on.

        The user should be aware that a call to getProbability(double[], int) will not return the same value as getCount(double[], int) / totalObservations, since dynamic correlation exclusion could be swithced on. To achieve this, the user could call getCompleteKernelCount(double[], int[], boolean) and use the returned count and totalObservationsForCount in the returned KernelCount object.

        Parameters:
        observation -
        timeStep -
        Returns:

      • getCountFromBins

        protected KernelCount getCountFromBins(double[] observation,
                           int timeStep,
                           boolean dynCorrExclusion,
                           boolean giveListOfCorrelatedPoints)
        Give kernel estimated count for this observation. Do this using bins, so we only need to compare to neighbouring bins and of course add in the observations in this bin. Achieves this by trawling through neighbouring bins in a recursive fashion.
        Parameters:
        observation -
        timeStep - of the given observation (required for dynamic correlation exclusion)
        dynCorrExclusion - whether to use dynamic correlation exclusion
        giveListOfCorrelatedPoints - include the list of time indices whose vectors were correlated with the given vector
        Returns:
        KernelCount object with the count and total observations the count was taken from

      • getCountComparingToAll

        protected KernelCount getCountComparingToAll(double[] observation,
                                 int timeStep,
                                 boolean dynCorrExclusion,
                                 boolean giveListOfCorrelatedPoints)
        Give kernel estimated count for this observation, by comparing to all given observations.
        Parameters:
        observation -
        timeStep - of the given observation (required for dynamic correlation exclusion)
        dynCorrExclusion - whether to use dynamic correlation exclusion
        Returns:
        KernelCount object with the count and total observations the count was taken from

      • setDebug

      • correlatedPointAddedCallback

        protected void correlatedPointAddedCallback(int correlatedTimeStep)
        A callback for where a correlated point is found. Used in child classes, but not here since we have set makeCorrelatedPointAddedCallback to false.

      • correlatedPointRemovedCallback

        protected void correlatedPointRemovedCallback(int removedCorrelatedTimeStep)
        A callback for where a correlated point is removed due to dynamic correlated exclusion. Used in child classes, but not here since we have set makeCorrelatedPointAddedCallback to false.

      • clone

        protected java.lang.Object clone()
                          throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Provide an implementation of the clone() method. This does not deeply copy all of the underlying data, just providing a copy of the references to it all. This is enough to protect the integrity of the kernel estimator however if the clone is supplied different data (though the clone should not alter the data).
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        See Also:
        Object.clone()
